channel.title: MoparCraft Twitter
channel.description: I believe mitb or davidi2 should create a twitter account for all the latest news on the server.

item.title: MoparCraft Twitter
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:60, topic:401131”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=498191.msg3721314#msg3721314 date=1313955660]

ventrillo is free…

No it isn’t. You can’t host a ventrilo server for free can you? You certainly can with mumble.

Well, you can legally host a server with a cap of 8 people, or you can find a cracked server without a cap. There is a way to get anything free, even if its not legit.
Well, you can legally host a server with a cap of 8 people, or you can find a cracked server without a cap. There is a way to get anything free, even if its not legit.

[/quote]But mumble is free, unlimited and legal.[/quote]
:facepalm: Stupid mobile opera and sending that twice somehow. Anyways, I never said anything about mumble, just that MITB said “no it isn’t.” to a ventrillo server not being free.

Read full topic

item.title: MoparCraft Twitter
item.dc:creator: @noobs_are_ftw noobs are ftw
item.description:
@noobs_are_ftw wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:40, topic:401131”][quote author=mironic link=topic=498191.msg3699237#msg3699237 date=1312645379]

Imo we really only needed a ventrillo or some kinda VoIP server that could be setup. I had a ventrillo server with 500 available slots a while back but I was frowned upon for suggesting it.

steam is better than vent.

I never go into these arguements, but here is a fast point. Steam requires registration and vent does not. Making vent easier to handle.

vent: $20 per mounth
steam: $0 hmmm and all you have to do is register.

steam > vent
[/quote]

Ventrilo costs and only runs on windows.
Steam is free and only runs on windows.

Mumble is free and runs everywhere.

I think it’s pretty obvious which wins this argument.[/quote]

linux > all

Read full topic

item.title: MoparCraft Twitter
item.dc:creator: @mironic mironic
item.description:
@mironic wrote:

CoonHunter:

I said easier to manage, as YOU control the server, not someone else. Also, you can easily find free vent server technology that can handle as many users as you want.

you controll the steam group O_o and you can PERMA ban someone from the group, as it will take another email address and id for someone to make another steam account… insted of just making a new name and “greifing” the vent…

Steam > vent.

Read full topic
